Remove observations with NAs:
```{r}
cex <- na.omit(cex)
cex <- cex[cex$fout > 0, ]
set.seed(123)
total <- nrow(cex)
train_idx <- sample(1:total, size=0.7*total)
test_idx <- setdiff(1:total, train_idx)
train <- cex[train_idx, ]
test <- cex[test_idx, ]
```

```{r}
ndur_model <- lm(log(ndur) ~ log(income) + log(food) + I(log(food)^2) + log(fout) + I(log(fout)^2) + hours + hourw + year, data = train)
summary(ndur_model)
ndur_pred_log <- predict(ndur_model, newdata = test)
ndur_pred <- exp(ndur_pred_log)
sq_diff <- (test$ndur - ndur_pred)^2
rmse <- sqrt(mean(sq_diff))
rmse
rmse_log <- sqrt(mean((log(test$ndur)-ndur_pred_log)^2))
```

```{r}
paper_lr <- lm(log(food) ~ log(ndur) + onec + twoc + three_plusc + hs_drop 
               + hs_grad + age + I(age^2) + northeast + midwest + south + fsize 
               + log(pfood) + `55-59` + `50-54` + `45-49` + `40-44` + `35-39` 
               + `30-34` + `25-29` + white, data = cex)
coef <- coef(paper_lr)
gamma <- coef[2]
betaDc <- predict(paper_lr, newdata = cex) - gamma*log(cex$ndur) 

cex$paper_ndur <- exp((log(cex$food) - betaDc)/gamma)

psid$lpfood <- log(psid$pfood)

betaDp <- (coef[3]*psid$onec + coef[4]*psid$twoc 
           + coef[5]*psid$three_plusc + coef[6]*psid$hs_drop + coef[7]*psid$hs_grad 
           + coef[8]*psid$age + coef[9]*psid$age^2 + coef[10]*psid$northeast 
           + coef[11]*psid$midwest + coef[12]*psid$south + coef[13]*psid$fsize 
           + coef[14]*psid$lpfood + coef[15]*psid$`55-59` + coef[16]*psid$`50-54` 
           + coef[17]*psid$`45-49` + coef[18]*psid$`40-44` + coef[19]*psid$`35-39` 
           + coef[20]*psid$`30-34` + coef[21]*psid$`25-29` + coef[22]*psid$white)

psid$paper_ndur <- exp((log(psid$food) - betaDp)/gamma)


```
```{r}


# Generate necessary variables (log-transformed values)
psid$lq <- log((psid$food) / psid$pf)
psid$lp <- log(psid$pf)

# Merge with other datasets if needed, e.g., `finprice` for price data
# merge() function can be used for merging datasets

# Generate dummy variables for region, education, cohort, etc.
psid$age2 <- psid$age^2
psid$kidcat <- as.factor(psid$kids)

```

```{r}
# Apply the imputation formula from Stata using the coefficients from CEX

# Example for `lc0` imputation using the formula from Stata
psid$lc0 <- (psid$lq - (
  b0["age"] * psid$age +
  b0["age2"] * psid$age2 +
  b0["lp"] * psid$lp +
  b0["lpalc"] * psid$lpalc +
  b0["lpfut"] * psid$lpfut +
  b0["lptra"] * psid$lptra +
  # Add other terms similarly for all variables from the regression
)) / (b0["lx"] + b0["lxed2"] * psid$edd2 + b0["lxed3"] * psid$edd3 + 
       b0["lxkid2"] * psid$kidd2 + b0["lxkid3"] * psid$kidd3 + b0["lxkid4"] * psid$kidd4 +
       # Add other interaction terms here
)


```
